templates.name: HUAWEI UPS2000-A-10KVA UPS SNMP
templates.description:
Template Power HUAWEI UPS

MIBs used:
PowerNet-MIB
SNMPv2-MIB

You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback/420730-discussion-thread-for-official-zabbix-template-apc-ups

Template tooling version used: 0.41

items.name: Battery backup time
items.description: 电池后备时间

items.name: Battery capacity
items.description:
MIB: PowerNet-MIB
The remaining battery capacity expressed as
 percentage of full capacity.

items.name: Battery current
items.description:
MIB: PowerNet-MIB
The actual battery bus voltage in Volts.

items.name: Battery row status
items.description:
RowStatus of UPS battery information table
active 1
notInService 2
notReady 3
createAndGo 4
createAndWait 5
destroy 6

items.name: Battery status
items.description:
电池状态。枚举类型。
     值 1 表示未连接电池。
     值 2 表示电池没有充电或放电。
     值 3 表示休眠。
     值 4 表示浮充电。
     值 5 表示均衡充电。
     值 6 表示放电。

triggers.name: Battery is Low
triggers.description: The UPS will be unable to sustain the current load, and its services will be lost if power is not restored.

triggers.name: 电池未充电或放电
triggers.description: A battery installed has an internal error condition.

items.name: UPS ctrl power State
items.description:
值 1 表示电源关闭。
值 2 表示正在启动。
值 3 表示上电失败。
值 4 表示成功上电

items.name: Battery voltage
items.description:
MIB: PowerNet-MIB
The actual battery bus voltage in Volts.

items.name: Bypass input frequency
items.description: 旁路电压

items.name: Bypass input voltage
items.description: 旁路电压

triggers.expression: min(/HUAWEI UPS2000-A-10KVA UPS SNMP/input.Bypass.voltage[upsHighPrecbypassInputVoltage],{$TIME.PERIOD}) > 0 and (min(/HUAWEI UPS2000-A-10KVA UPS SNMP/input.Bypass.voltage[upsHighPrecbypassInputVoltage],{$TIME.PERIOD}) > {$UPS.INPUT_VOLT.MAX.WARN} or max(/HUAWEI UPS2000-A-10KVA UPS SNMP/input.Bypass.voltage[upsHighPrecbypassInputVoltage],{$TIME.PERIOD}) < {$UPS.INPUT_VOLT.MIN.WARN})
triggers.name: Unacceptable input voltage (out of range {$UPS.INPUT_VOLT.MIN.WARN}-{$UPS.INPUT_VOLT.MAX.WARN}V for {$TIME.PERIOD})

items.name: Input fail cause
items.description:
MIB: PowerNet-MIB
The reason for the occurrence of the last transfer to UPS
battery power.  The variable is set to:
- noTransfer(1) -- if there is no transfer yet.
- highLineVoltage(2) -- if the transfer to battery is caused
by an over voltage greater than the high transfer voltage.
- brownout(3) -- if the duration of the outage is greater than
five seconds and the line voltage is between 40% of the
rated output voltage and the low transfer voltage.
- blackout(4) -- if the duration of the outage is greater than five
seconds and the line voltage is between 40% of the rated
output voltage and ground.
- smallMomentarySag(5) -- if the duration of the outage is less
than five seconds and the line voltage is between 40% of the
rated output voltage and the low transfer voltage.
- deepMomentarySag(6) -- if the duration of the outage is less
than five seconds and the line voltage is between 40% of the
rated output voltage and ground.  The variable is set to
- smallMomentarySpike(7) -- if the line failure is caused by a
rate of change of input voltage less than ten volts per cycle.
- largeMomentarySpike(8) -- if the line failure is caused by
a rate of change of input voltage greater than ten volts per cycle.
- selfTest(9) -- if the UPS was commanded to do a self test.
- rateOfVoltageChange(10) -- if the failure is due to the rate of change of
the line voltage.

items.name: Input frequency
items.description:
MIB: PowerNet-MIB
The current input frequency to the UPS system in Hz.

triggers.expression: min(/HUAWEI UPS2000-A-10KVA UPS SNMP/input.frequency[upsHighPrecInputFrequency],{$TIME.PERIOD}) > 0 and (min(/HUAWEI UPS2000-A-10KVA UPS SNMP/input.frequency[upsHighPrecInputFrequency],{$TIME.PERIOD}) > {$UPS.INPUT_FREQ.MAX.WARN} or max(/HUAWEI UPS2000-A-10KVA UPS SNMP/input.frequency[upsHighPrecInputFrequency],{$TIME.PERIOD}) < {$UPS.INPUT_FREQ.MIN.WARN})
triggers.name: Unacceptable input frequency (out of range {$UPS.INPUT_FREQ.MIN.WARN}-{$UPS.INPUT_FREQ.MAX.WARN}Hz for {$TIME.PERIOD})

items.name: Input voltage
items.description:
MIB: PowerNet-MIB
The iutput voltage of the UPS system in VAC.

items.name: Output Active Power
items.description: 输出有用功率

items.name: Output Appearance Power
items.description: 输出视在功率

items.name: Output frequency
items.description:
MIB: PowerNet-MIB
The current Onput frequency to the UPS system in Hz.

items.name: Output current
items.description:
MIB: PowerNet-MIB
The current in amperes drawn by the load on the UPS.

items.name: Output load
items.description:
MIB: PowerNet-MIB
The current UPS load expressed as percentage
of rated capacity.

triggers.name: Output load is high (over {$UPS.OUTPUT.MAX.WARN}% for {$TIME.PERIOD})
triggers.description: A battery installed has an internal error condition.

items.name: Output voltage
items.description:
MIB: PowerNet-MIB
The output voltage of the UPS system in VAC.

items.name: SNMP traps (fallback)
items.description: The item is used to collect all SNMP traps unmatched by other snmptrap items

items.name: System contact details
items.description:
MIB: SNMPv2-MIB
The textual identification of the contact person for this managed
node, together with information on how to contact this person.  If no contact
information is known, the value is the zero-length string.

items.name: System description
items.description:
MIB: SNMPv2-MIB
A textual description of the entity. This value should
include the full name and version identification of the system's hardware type, software operating-system, and
networking software.

items.name: System location
items.description:
MIB: SNMPv2-MIB
The physical location of this node (e.g., `telephone closet,
3rd floor').  If the location is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

items.name: Power supply method
items.description:
"设备供电方式。枚举类型。
     值 1 表示无电源。
     值 2 表示旁路模式。
     值 3 表示正常模式。
     值 4 表示电池模式。
     值 5 表示组合模式。
     值 6 表示市电 ECO 模式。
     值 7 表示电池 ECO 模式。

items.name: System name
items.description:
MIB: SNMPv2-MIB
An administratively-assigned name for this managed node.By
convention, this is the node's fully-qualified domain name.  If the name is unknown,
the value is the zero-length string.

triggers.expression: last(/HUAWEI UPS2000-A-10KVA UPS SNMP/system.name[sysName.0],#1)<>last(/HUAWEI UPS2000-A-10KVA UPS SNMP/system.name[sysName.0],#2) and length(last(/HUAWEI UPS2000-A-10KVA UPS SNMP/system.name[sysName.0]))>0
triggers.name: System name has changed (new name: {ITEM.VALUE})
triggers.description: System name has changed. Ack to close.

items.name: System object ID
items.description:
MIB: SNMPv2-MIB
The vendor's authoritative identification of the network management
subsystem contained in the entity.  This value is allocated within the SMI enterprises
subtree (1.3.6.1.4.1) and provides an easy and unambiguous means for determining`what
kind of box' is being managed.  For example, if vendor`Flintstones, Inc.' was
assigned the subtree1.3.6.1.4.1.4242, it could assign the identifier 1.3.6.1.4.1.4242.1.1
to its `Fred Router'.

items.name: Serial number
items.description:
MIB: PowerNet-MIB
An 8-character string identifying the serial number of
 the UPS internal microprocessor.  This number is set at
 the factory.  NOTE: This number does NOT correspond to
 the serial number on the rear of the UPS.

items.name: Uptime
items.description:
MIB: SNMPv2-MIB
The time (in hundredths of a second) since the network management
portion of the system was last re-initialized.

items.name: UPS device temperature
items.description: 主机温度

items.name: UPS device running status
items.description:
UPS 运行状态。 枚举类型。
值 1 表示单个 UPS 正在运行。
值 2 表示并行系统正在运行。
值 3 表示单个 UPS 在 ECO 模式下运行。
值 4 表示并机系统在 ECO 模式下运行。
值 5 表示老化。

items.name: SNMP agent availability
items.description:
Availability of SNMP checks on the host. The value of this item corresponds to availability icons in the host list.
Possible value:
0 - not available
1 - available
2 - unknown

triggers.name: No SNMP data collection
triggers.description: SNMP is not available for polling. Please check device connectivity and SNMP settings.

discovery_rules.name: External bad battery packs discovery
discovery_rules.description: Discovery of the number of external defective battery packs.

item_prototypes.name: {#SNMPINDEX}: External battery packs bad
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: PowerNet-MIB
The number of external battery packs connected to the UPS that
are defective. If the UPS does not use smart cells then the
agent reports ERROR_NO_SUCH_NAME.

item_prototypes.name: {#BATTERY_PACK}.{#CARTRIDGE_INDEX}: Battery estimated replace date
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: PowerNet-MIB
The battery cartridge estimated battery replace date.

item_prototypes.name: {#BATTERY_PACK}.{#CARTRIDGE_INDEX}: Battery pack cartridge health
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: PowerNet-MIB
The battery cartridge health.
  bit 0 Battery lifetime okay
  bit 1 Battery lifetime near end, order replacement cartridge
  bit 2 Battery lifetime exceeded, replace battery
  bit 3 Battery lifetime near end acknowledged, order replacement cartridge
  bit 4 Battery lifetime exceeded acknowledged, replace battery
  bit 5 Battery measured lifetime near end, order replacement cartridge
  bit 6 Battery measured lifetime near end acknowledged, order replacement cartridge

trigger_prototypes.name: {#BATTERY_PACK}.{#CARTRIDGE_INDEX}: Battery lifetime is not okay
trigger_prototypes.description:
The battery cartridge health.
  bit 0 Battery lifetime okay
  bit 1 Battery lifetime near end, order replacement cartridge
  bit 2 Battery lifetime exceeded, replace battery
  bit 3 Battery lifetime near end acknowledged, order replacement cartridge
  bit 4 Battery lifetime exceeded acknowledged, replace battery
  bit 5 Battery measured lifetime near end, order replacement cartridge
  bit 6 Battery measured lifetime near end acknowledged, order replacement cartridge

item_prototypes.name: {#BATTERY_PACK}.{#CARTRIDGE_INDEX}: Battery status
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: PowerNet-MIB
The battery cartridge status.
bit 0 Disconnected
bit 1 Overvoltage
bit 2 NeedsReplacement
bit 3 OvertemperatureCritical
bit 4 Charger
bit 5 TemperatureSensor
bit 6 BusSoftStart
bit 7 OvertemperatureWarning
bit 8 GeneralError
bit 9 Communication
bit 10 DisconnectedFrame
bit 11 FirmwareMismatch

trigger_prototypes.name: {#BATTERY_PACK}.{#CARTRIDGE_INDEX}: Battery status is not okay
trigger_prototypes.description:
The battery cartridge status:
bit 0 Disconnected
bit 1 Overvoltage
bit 2 NeedsReplacement
bit 3 OvertemperatureCritical
bit 4 Charger
bit 5 TemperatureSensor
bit 6 BusSoftStart
bit 7 OvertemperatureWarning
bit 8 GeneralError
bit 9 Communication
bit 10 DisconnectedFrame
bit 11 FirmwareMismatch

item_prototypes.name: {#BATTERY_PACK}.{#CARTRIDGE_INDEX}: Battery temperature
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: PowerNet-MIB
The battery pack temperature in Celsius.

item_prototypes.name: {#BATTERY_PACK}.{#CARTRIDGE_INDEX}: Serial number
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: PowerNet-MIB
The battery pack serial number.

item_prototypes.name: {#EXTERNAL_SENSOR1_NAME}: Humidity sensor
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: PowerNet-MIB
The sensor's current humidity reading - a relative humidity
 percentage. -1 indicates an invalid reading due to either a
 sensor that doesn't read humidity or lost communications.

item_prototypes.name: {#EXTERNAL_SENSOR1_NAME}: Sensor alarm status
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: PowerNet-MIB
The alarm status of the sensor. Possible values:
uioNormal                 (1),
uioWarning                (2),
uioCritical               (3),
sensorStatusNotApplicable (4)

trigger_prototypes.name: {#EXTERNAL_SENSOR1_NAME}: Sensor has status Critical
trigger_prototypes.description: The external sensor has returned a value greater than the critical threshold.

trigger_prototypes.name: {#EXTERNAL_SENSOR1_NAME}: Sensor has status Not Applicable
trigger_prototypes.description: The external sensor does not work or is not connected.

trigger_prototypes.name: {#EXTERNAL_SENSOR1_NAME}: Sensor has status Warning
trigger_prototypes.description: The external sensor has returned a value greater than the warning threshold.

item_prototypes.name: {#EXTERNAL_SENSOR1_NAME}: Temperature sensor
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: PowerNet-MIB
The sensor's current temperature reading in Celsius.
 -1 indicates an invalid reading due to lost communications.

item_prototypes.name: {#EXTERNAL_SENSOR2_NAME}: Humidity sensor
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: PowerNet-MIB
The sensor's current humidity reading - a relative humidity
 percentage. -1 indicates an invalid reading due to either a
 sensor that doesn't read humidity or lost communications.

item_prototypes.name: {#EXTERNAL_SENSOR2_NAME}: Sensor alarm status
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: PowerNet-MIB
The alarm status of the sensor. Possible values:
uioNormal                 (1),
uioWarning                (2),
uioCritical               (3),
sensorStatusNotApplicable (4)

trigger_prototypes.name: {#EXTERNAL_SENSOR2_NAME}: Sensor has status Critical
trigger_prototypes.description: The external sensor has returned a value greater than the critical threshold.

trigger_prototypes.name: {#EXTERNAL_SENSOR2_NAME}: Sensor has status Not Applicable
trigger_prototypes.description: The external sensor does not work or is not connected.

trigger_prototypes.name: {#EXTERNAL_SENSOR2_NAME}: Sensor has status Warning
trigger_prototypes.description: The external sensor has returned a value greater than the warning threshold.

item_prototypes.name: {#EXTERNAL_SENSOR2_NAME}: Temperature sensor
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: PowerNet-MIB
The sensor's current temperature reading in Celsius.
 -1 indicates an invalid reading due to lost communications.

discovery_rules.name: Input phases discovery
discovery_rules.description: The input phase identifier. OID upsPhaseInputPhaseIndex.1.1

item_prototypes.name: {#PHASEINDEX}: Phase input current
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: PowerNet-MIB
The input current in 0.1 amperes, or -0.1 if it's
 unsupported by this UPS.

item_prototypes.name: {#PHASEINDEX}: Phase input voltage
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: PowerNet-MIB
The input voltage in VAC, or -1 if it's unsupported
 by this UPS.

trigger_prototypes.expression: min(/HUAWEI UPS2000-A-10KVA UPS SNMP/phase.input.voltage[upsPhaseInputVoltage.1.1.{#PHASEINDEX}],{$TIME.PERIOD}) > {$UPS.INPUT_VOLT.MAX.WARN} or max(/HUAWEI UPS2000-A-10KVA UPS SNMP/phase.input.voltage[upsPhaseInputVoltage.1.1.{#PHASEINDEX}],{$TIME.PERIOD}) < {$UPS.INPUT_VOLT.MIN.WARN}
trigger_prototypes.name: {#PHASEINDEX}: Unacceptable phase {#PHASEINDEX} input voltage (out of range {$UPS.INPUT_VOLT.MIN.WARN}-{$UPS.INPUT_VOLT.MAX.WARN}V for {$TIME.PERIOD})

discovery_rules.name: Output phases discovery
discovery_rules.description: The output phase identifier. OID upsPhaseOutputPhaseIndex.1.1

item_prototypes.name: {#PHASEINDEX}: Phase output current
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: PowerNet-MIB
The output current in 0.1 amperes drawn
 by the load on the UPS, or -1 if it's unsupported
 by this UPS.

item_prototypes.name: {#PHASEINDEX}: Phase output load, %
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: PowerNet-MIB
The percentage of the UPS load capacity in VA at
 redundancy @ (n + x) presently being used on this
 output phase, or -1 if it's unsupported by this UPS.

item_prototypes.name: {#PHASEINDEX}: Phase output voltage
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: PowerNet-MIB
The output voltage in VAC, or -1 if it's unsupported
 by this UPS.

trigger_prototypes.expression: min(/HUAWEI UPS2000-A-10KVA UPS SNMP/phase.output.voltage[upsPhaseOutputVoltage.1.1.{#PHASEINDEX}],{$TIME.PERIOD}) > {$UPS.INPUT_VOLT.MAX.WARN} or max(/HUAWEI UPS2000-A-10KVA UPS SNMP/phase.output.voltage[upsPhaseOutputVoltage.1.1.{#PHASEINDEX}],{$TIME.PERIOD}) < {$UPS.INPUT_VOLT.MIN.WARN}
trigger_prototypes.name: {#PHASEINDEX}: Unacceptable phase {#PHASEINDEX} output voltage (out of range {$UPS.INPUT_VOLT.MIN.WARN}-{$UPS.INPUT_VOLT.MAX.WARN}V for {$TIME.PERIOD})

macros.description: Minimum battery capacity percentage for trigger expression.
Maximum battery temperature for trigger expression.
The time interval for SNMP agent availability trigger expression.
Maximum input frequency for trigger expression.
Minimum input frequency for trigger expression.
Maximum input voltage for trigger expression.
Minimum input voltage for trigger expression.
Maximum output load in % for trigger expression.
